name: 觀光與社會變遷
description: This course aims to introduce the new emergent issues of tourism studies under current great social transformation. It includes the discussion on the ‘mobility turn’ in tourism studies, which emphasis on the issues such as the inseparability of tourists from migrants and residents. When society can no longer ignore its underpinning base upon the changing environment, tourism is also now affected heavily by different unpredictable natural disasters, from Tsunami to Volcanic Eruption. The current complex society also urges the society under new surveillance and control. New technology is not only highly intermediated with the imagination and destination-making within tourism, but also creates virtual tourism and leads to the post-tourism. Current tourism concentrates less on authenticity and exoticism than extending itself into many unexpected dimensions, from creative tourism to dark tourism. Gender and ethnicity are still important parts of tourism, nevertheless, the postcolonial tourism no longer simply emphasized the power relationship but transform and rearticulate the colonial elements into the new asset of tourism-making. Sex tourism has not diminished but transformed into multiple forms, from gay tourism, stag tourism to new hedonism. However, safety, security and sustainability rather turns to be a significant issue for tourism. Many new tourist practices thus need to adapt to the emergent complex society, from the travel insurance provision to sorting tourism under surveillance society.
goals: To understand the emergent  phenomenon on tourism
To understand tourism under the context of social transformation
To cultivate the critical capacity to organize and arrange new tourism attraction
To form cosmopolitan vision in appreciate tourist cultures
